6th December 1933.
Mrs. Hudson E. Bridge,
Route 2, Box 1004,
Clayton, MISSOURI,
U. S. A.
Dear Urs. Bridge,
my
Please pardon the type written letter,
excuse is that I am very
busy
and
have had
to write so
much long hand recently that my right arm is giving me
some trouble.
Your first letter reached me soon after
Dwight had arrived in Shanghai.
I showed it to him and he
told
me a day
or two later that he had written to you. Your
second letter of
September 24th was forwarded to me in
Manila, and I
bably
thought when
I received it
that I would
pro-
see you
in person before any letter which I wrote to
you would arrive.
Unfortunately however, my affairs
here have
taken a turn
which

cancel my
trip home,
at least
for
the
time
being.
I left

Holiday.

properties.sfomuseum:description: Typewritten letter from Harold M. Bixby to Mrs. Hudson E. Bridge, dated December 6, 1933; copy sent to Debby Bixby; includes greetings to Dwight Bridge’s mother.
properties.wof:name: correspondence: Harold M. Bixby to Mrs. Hudson E. Bridge
